content: Morning Rohan. Just confirming your full-body MRI is booked for Tue 4 Nov, 8:30 AM at Prenuvo. I'll be on-site to handle check-in so you can go straight in.
Perfect, thanks Ruby. Appreciate you taking care of the logistics üôè
Hi Rohan, wanted to note again how significant your ApoB improvement is, 88 mg/dL is firmly into optimal range. This MRI will help us go even deeper into prevention.
That's good to hear, Neel. Makes the effort feel worthwhile.
Rohan, just a quick note - your cook asked about dinner swaps. I suggested more oily fish this week (salmon, mackerel) to reinforce the ApoB gains. Sound ok?
Yep, that works. Thanks Carla.
Morning Rohan, reminder that we're on the new 2-week cycle for your training plan. Today's session is light mobility + short run. Keep HR in Zone 2.
Got it. Quick 20 mins before work should be doable.
Just confirming, driver is arranged for tomorrow's MRI, pickup 7:45 AM. I'll meet you directly at reception.
Thanks Ruby, smooth as always.
I'm at Prenuvo now. Priority check-in is ready, just walk straight in when you arrive.
All checked in, thanks for being here.
MRI completed. Dr. Warren will review the scans with the specialist radiologist this afternoon. We'll update you tomorrow.
Great. Was smoother than expected, thanks for handling it.
I've been thinking about our discussion on cognitive reserve. I've decided I want to start learning the piano. I see this as part of my long-term health strategy.
That's an excellent decision, Rohan. We'll officially add 'Weekly Piano Practice' as a 'Pillar 5: Cognitive Health' in your plan. This is a true Stage 3 milestone: you're co-creating your journey.
Feels good to add something proactive and enjoyable into the mix.
To measure piano's impact on cognitive performance, I suggest a quick daily journal. Just rate your mental focus 1-5. We'll correlate with practice consistency.
Simple enough. I'll start logging today.
Would it help if I researched top-rated piano instructors near you who work with adult learners? I can shortlist based on availability.
Yes please. That'd save me time.
I've reviewed your MRI with the radiologist. Results are reassuring - no concerning findings. This is an important longevity baseline. We'll share a written summary for your records.
That's a relief. Thanks Warren.
Rohan, today's movement block is light strength‚Äîbodyweight and resistance bands only. Just 15-20 min, fits before work.
On it. Quick session now.
I've shortlisted 3 piano instructors - two offer in-home sessions, one has a studio near your office. Sending profiles separately for you to pick.
Brilliant, thanks Ruby.
Advik, I read that neuroplasticity benefits of instruments tie to 'deliberate practice'. Any good frameworks on what that looks like?
Great question. Deliberate practice = focused, structured, slightly beyond current ability, with feedback. I'll send you a resource by Ericsson on it, clear frameworks you can apply to piano.
That'd be perfect, thanks. I like having structure.
Morning! Just checking how yesterday's focus rating went. Was the 1-5 scale easy enough to log?
Yep, logged a 3 yesterday. Simple system.
This new pillar really reflects where you are in the journey, Rohan - balancing health, resilience, and now cognitive enrichment. It's a strong signal of long-term alignment.
Agree. Feels like the right next step.
By the way, piano practice in evenings can replace a late snack habit. If you notice evening munchies, try a short practice session instead.
Nice hack, I'll test it out.
Quick reminder: your updated weekly dashboard will include piano practice consistency + focus scores starting Monday.
Excellent. Looking forward to seeing that.
How's your back feeling after adding piano posture to your day? We may need to tweak stretching if you notice stiffness.
All good so far, Rachel. Will flag if anything comes up.
